main_definition: Everyone refers to all the people in a particular group or context without exception.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Inclusive of all persons present in a specific situation or place.
meanings_and_examples.example: When the teacher asked if anyone needed help, she said 'everyone' to include every student.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to express that something is universally applicable and applies to all cases.
meanings_and_examples.example: Everyone should follow the safety rules when using machinery at work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicates a general or hypothetical group of people without specifying any particular individuals.
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Eating healthy is important for everyone' implies it applies to all individuals, although specific examples may vary.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Can imply an expectation or assumption that something will be done by every individual within a group.
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Everyone in the family should clean their room.' assumes each member of the family is responsible for cleaning.
